Class MRMail

java.lang.Object
  MRMail
All Implemented Interfaces:
MRConnectionHandler
public class MRMail
extends java.lang.Object
implements MRConnectionHandler

All the functionality for handeling mails is here This server needs a POP3 account somewhere and a SMTP server for sending mails Please look at INSTALL

Field Summary
(package private)  boolean DEBUG
          if true, more output - useful for debugging
(package private)  boolean FLUSH
          flushes the mails after processing them Set this true (recommended) or the mails will be processed again and again

Method Detail

run

public void run(int minutes)
Runs popmail() and sleeps for minutes given

Parameters:
minutes - the interval between two "pops"

popmail

public void popmail()
Does all the work gets a connection to the POP3 server, receives the mails, processes them and sends out answer mails

parseContent

private void parseContent(java.lang.String content,
                          javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress mySender)
Takes a line from the mailbody, makes a MRData object with the help of the MRDataParser, queries the DB and sends the answer back to the sender of the mail

Parameters:
content - a line from the body of a mail
mySender - the mailaddress to send the answer mail to

sendMail

private void sendMail(java.util.Vector myData,
                      javax.mail.internet.InternetAddress mySender)
Takes a vector of vectors of MRData objects (every query results in a vector of MRData objects) and the mailaddress to send the answer mail to

Parameters:
myData - a vector of vectors of MRData objects
mySender - the mailaddress to send the answer mail to

send

public java.util.Vector send(MRData myData)
Takes a MRData object and asks the DB. Gets back a vector of MRData objects

Specified by:
send in interface MRConnectionHandler
Parameters:
myData - a MRData object
Returns:
a Vector of MRData objects
